thread.title: Britain’s New Housing Dilemma

author: Samuel Tombs
title: Britain’s New Housing Dilemma

organizations.name: bank of england’s monetary policy committee

text:
Investors expect the Bank of England’s Monetary Policy Committee to raise its policy rate twice this year. But for the first time in years, the housing market might throw a wrench into the monetary-policy works.
The MPC has been able to set interest rates in recent years without paying much attention to the housing market. Since Mark Carney took the helm in July 2013, annual growth in house prices has averaged 6% and has never escaped a 2% to 9% range, contrasting with the roller-coaster ride of the previous 25 years. Meanwhile...
